item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed Seagate Technology Holdings said in a filing that the U.S. government has warned the company that it […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed Seagate Technology Holdings said in a filing that the U.S. government has warned the company that it may have violated export control laws by providing hard disk drives to a customer that a source familiar with the situation identified as Huawei Technologies. Huawei is on the U.S. Commerce Department’s entity list and banned from receiving U.S. exports and certain foreign-made items without government approval.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Korean auto giant Hyundai investigating child labor in its U.S. supply chain
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Hyundai Motor Co, Korea’s top automaker, is investigating child labor violations in its U.S. supply chain […]

The post Reuters reveals Korean auto giant Hyundai investigating child labor in its U.S. supply chain appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Hyundai Motor Co, Korea’s top automaker, is investigating child labor violations in its U.S. supply chain and plans to sever ties with Hyundai suppliers in Alabama found to have relied on underage workers. A Reuters investigative report in July documented children, including a 12-year-old, working at a Hyundai-controlled metal stamping plant in rural Alabama.

item.title: Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that Assa Abloy, the world’s leading lockmaker, is considering options including selling its Yale and […]

The post Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that Assa Abloy, the world’s leading lockmaker, is considering options including selling its Yale and Emtek locks brands as it seeks to overturn U.S. antitrust opposition to its planned purchase of Spectrum’s Hardware and Home Improvement. The news comes just weeks after the U.S. Department of Justice sued to block the company’s proposed $4.3 billion deal to buy a unit of Spectrum Brands Holdings that makes security, plumbing and builders’ hardware products.

The post Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals White House rules out ban on natural gas exports this winter
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report the White House has ruled out any ban or curbs on natural-gas exports this winter, […]

The post Reuters reveals White House rules out ban on natural gas exports this winter appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report the White House has ruled out any ban or curbs on natural-gas exports this winter, in a bid to help alleviate energy shortages in Europe. In March, U.S. President Joe Biden committed to delivering 15 billion cubic metres more of liquefied natural gas to Europe following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine; the U.S. has already surpassed that goal.

The post Reuters reveals White House rules out ban on natural gas exports this winter appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Credit Suisse talks with investors; shares drop to new low
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Credit Suisse is sounding out investors for fresh cash, approaching them for the fourth time in […]

The post Reuters reveals Credit Suisse talks with investors; shares drop to new low appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Credit Suisse is sounding out investors for fresh cash, approaching them for the fourth time in around seven years as it attempts a radical overhaul of its investment bank. The investment bank is also evaluating various scenarios, including the most drastic option of largely exiting the U.S. market. Credit Suisse shares fell by more than ten percent to their lowest level on record after Reuters revealed the news. 

The post Reuters reveals Credit Suisse talks with investors; shares drop to new low appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Delta Air Lines readies refinery to process biofuels
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Delta Air Lines plans to start receiving shipments of renewable fuel feedstocks at its Trainer, Pennsylvania, […]

The post Reuters reveals Delta Air Lines readies refinery to process biofuels appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed that Delta Air Lines plans to start receiving shipments of renewable fuel feedstocks at its Trainer, Pennsylvania, refinery as part of a strategy that could reduce its environmental liabilities by hundreds of millions of dollars. Sources said the refinery is expected to start importing agricultural products such as soybean oil, which can be used to make a biomass-based diesel that satisfies federal blending requirements.

item.title: Reuters reveals Biden urges Mexico to take migrants under COVID expulsion order he promised to end
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that U.S. President Joe Biden’s administration is quietly pressing Mexico to accept more migrants from […]

The post Reuters reveals Biden urges Mexico to take migrants under COVID expulsion order he promised to end appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that U.S. President Joe Biden’s administration is quietly pressing Mexico to accept more migrants from Cuba, Nicaragua, and Venezuela under a COVID-19 expulsion order that the White House has publicly sought to end. Most migrants from these countries who cross into the U.S are allowed to stay to pursue asylum claims since they are difficult to deport due to frosty diplomatic relations with their governments.

The post Reuters reveals Biden urges Mexico to take migrants under COVID expulsion order he promised to end appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Biden to hit China with broader curbs on U.S. chip and tool exports
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that the Biden administration plans next month to broaden curbs on U.S shipments to China […]

The post Reuters reveals Biden to hit China with broader curbs on U.S. chip and tool exports appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that the Biden administration plans next month to broaden curbs on U.S shipments to China of semiconductors used for artificial intelligence and chipmaking tools. The move would expand the reach of the limits and could subject other U.S. companies producing similar technology to the restrictions. 

The post Reuters reveals Biden to hit China with broader curbs on U.S. chip and tool exports appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
